assignments.label: Assignment 1
assignments.title: Data Science
assignments.reflection: This assignment helped me learn the basics of data science. I now understand how important data is for making decisions and how tools like data visualization and prediction can make it easier to understand and use data. This gave me a better idea of what data science is all about and made me more interested in exploring it.

assignments.label: Assignment 2
assignments.title: Operators
assignments.reflection: This gave me a good idea of how to use operators in R. It showed me how I can use them to solve problems and work with data in a simple way through exploring arithmetic, relational, logical, and other operators. It also helped me understand how to combine different operations to make my code work better.

activities.label: All About Me
activities.title: Introduction
activities.reflection: This activity made me think about myself and my goals for this course. Writing about my traits and what I hope to achieve helped me focus on what I want to learn in the field of data science by enabling me to assess my current knowledge on the topics.

activities.label: Activity 1
activities.title: Leveraging Big Data and Data Science
activities.reflection: In this activity, I learned how big data and data science can help solve real problems. I found out how things like predictive analytics and clustering can give useful insights. It also made me aware of the challenges in using data, like managing poor-quality data and working with others to make it effective.

activities.label: Activity 3
activities.title: Working with Vectors and Data Frames
activities.reflection: This activity helped me understand how to work with vectors and data frames in R. I learned how to get specific data, add new columns, and fix missing values. It was a good practice for working with structured data in simple ways.

activities.label: Activity 4
activities.title: Manipulating and Merging Data
activities.reflection: This activity taught me how to combine and organize data so it’s easier to use. I practiced joining tables and grouping data, which made me realize how useful these skills are for working with larger datasets.

activities.label: Activity 5
activities.title: Using Built-in Functions and Control Structures
activities.reflection: This activity showed me how to use R’s built-in functions and control structures to write better code. I learned how to make functions reusable and write code that checks conditions, which are useful skills for solving everyday coding problems.

activities.label: Activity 6
activities.title: Using APPLY Family FUNCTIONS
activities.reflection: Using the APPLY family of functions helped me see how to make my code shorter and simpler. I practiced applying these functions to tasks like calculating averages and filtering data. It made repetitive tasks much easier and saved a lot of time.
